heroIntro: Welcome to your ideal family home in Aspe, a charming town in the heart of Costa Blanca. This stunning 3-bedroom villa offers the perfect blend of space, comfort, and value that modern families are searching for. With 140m² of thoughtfully designed living space and a generous 400m² plot, your children will have room to play safely while you enjoy a peaceful Mediterranean lifestyle. At €380,000, this property represents exceptional value—40% less than comparable homes on Spanish island markets—without compromising on quality or modern specifications. Located in a safe, established neighborhood with excellent access to international schools, healthcare facilities, and family-friendly amenities, this villa checks every box for families looking to relocate to Spain. Whether you're seeking a permanent family home or a smart investment property with strong rental potential (€800 per week typical), this property delivers outstanding returns and lifestyle benefits.
areaSection: Aspe is a vibrant town of approximately 7,000 residents located in the province of Alicante, just 30 minutes from the coast and major airports. Nestled in the Vinalopó Valley, this authentic Spanish community combines traditional Mediterranean charm with modern conveniences, making it increasingly popular with international families. The town enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually and a temperate climate that's perfect for year-round outdoor living. Unlike more touristy coastal areas, Aspe maintains its genuine Spanish character while welcoming an established international community. The town center features weekly markets, local restaurants serving authentic cuisine, and historic architecture alongside contemporary development. Property prices here remain 8% below the previous year's average, indicating strong market momentum and excellent investment timing. The surrounding countryside offers beautiful views across vineyards and almond groves, creating a peaceful rural backdrop just minutes from urban conveniences.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Aspe centers around community, affordability, and Mediterranean ease. The town's welcoming expat community means English is widely spoken, and you'll find familiar support networks alongside authentic Spanish neighbors. Shopping is convenient with modern supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum) alongside traditional weekly markets offering fresh local produce. School runs are manageable thanks to excellent road infrastructure and several international school options in the region, many offering British curriculum education. Healthcare is world-class and accessible—private clinics with English-speaking doctors complement regional hospitals just 30 minutes away, giving families complete peace of mind. Weekends often involve trips to pristine Blue Flag beaches just 20 minutes away, championship golf courses for active families, or exploring nearby historic towns. The lower cost of living compared to northern Europe and island markets means your family budget stretches further, allowing more experiences and better quality of life.
investmentSection: Beyond its appeal as a family home, this villa represents a smart financial investment. The Costa Blanca property market has experienced consistent +8% year-on-year growth, and Aspe sits at the forefront of this expansion as savvy investors recognize its value. At €2,714/m², this property trades at a premium specification level yet remains €500/m² above the town average, reflecting its quality and condition. Rental potential is substantial—comparable 3-bedroom villas in Aspe generate approximately €800 per week during peak season, translating to 20-25% annual returns for owner-investors. Whether held as a long-term family residence with potential holiday rental income, or as a buy-to-let investment, this villa offers diversified returns. The established international community ensures consistent demand from both long-term expat residents and seasonal holiday renters, reducing vacancy risk compared to purely tourist-focused properties.
conclusion: This exceptional 3-bedroom villa in Aspe represents far more than just property purchase—it's an investment in your family's lifestyle, future security, and Mediterranean quality of life. At €380,000 with premium build quality and space to grow, you're acquiring a home where children can play safely, families gather comfortably, and memories are created daily. The combination of outstanding value (40% below island markets), proven investment potential, excellent international community, and uncompromising access to healthcare and education makes this property a clear choice for discerning families. Whether your vision involves permanent relocation or a seasonal retreat generating rental income, this villa delivers. Take the next step toward your Costa Blanca family story. faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit vastgoed?
faqs.answer: €380,000. This 3-bedroom villa represents outstanding value for premium build quality, with pricing 40% below comparable Spanish island markets. Flexible payment arrangements and mortgage options are available for qualified international buyers.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders vastgoed kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign buyers have the same rights as Spanish citizens to purchase property in Spain. No residency requirement exists, and the process is straightforward with proper legal representation. Most major nationalities complete purchases within 4-6 weeks with appropriate legal support.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van het kopen van vastgoed in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-8% transfer tax (ITP), 1.2% notary and registration fees, and approximately 1% for legal representation—totaling roughly 8-10% of the purchase price in addition to the property cost. Some regions offer reduced transfer tax rates for first-time buyers or under specific circumstances.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers significantly lower living costs than northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a family of four typically range €2,000-€3,500 including rent/mortgage, utilities, groceries, and childcare—substantially less than UK equivalent areas. Dining out and recreational activities remain very affordable.

faqs.question: Heb ik een visum nodig om vastgoed te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: No, purchasing property does not require a visa. However, if you plan to reside in Spain, visa requirements depend on your nationality. UK citizens can stay up to 90 days visa-free; longer residence typically requires visa application through Spanish authorities or a mortgage-based residency certificate.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerendgoedbelasting in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) in Aspe averages 0.4-0.6% of property value—approximately €1,500-€2,300 yearly for this €380,000 property. This is significantly lower than many international jurisdictions. Additional annual costs include utility fees and optional community fees if applicable.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers routinely obtain mortgages from Spanish and international banks. Most lenders require 30% down payment minimum, proof of income, and proper legal documentation. Interest rates are competitive, typically 3-4%, and terms extend up to 25 years for qualified borrowers.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om vastgoed te kopen?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca demonstrates consistent market growth (+8% year-on-year), excellent rental demand from both holiday and expat renters, and strong international buyer interest. The combination of affordability, lifestyle quality, healthcare access, and strong economic fundamentals makes it one of Spain's most attractive property markets.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with average temperatures around 18°C (winter) and 28°C (summer). Rainfall averages 300mm yearly, concentrated in autumn and spring. This Mediterranean climate is ideal for year-round outdoor living and activities.

faqs.question: Is Aspe suitable for families relocating from the UK?
faqs.answer: Yes, Aspe is increasingly popular with British families relocating to Spain. The established English-speaking expat community, international schools with British curriculum options, excellent healthcare, and significantly lower cost of living make it ideal for family relocation. Many families integrate quickly while maintaining their lifestyle standards.
